body:
Hi everyone.

I have been playing with a pretty bad laptop for the past 2 years, and have saved up a bit of money to get a new one.
But I am still trying to decide which one.
If anyone could leave a link or a comment, it would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks :)
body_tagged:

Thanks :)
title: Computers

replies.body: What's your budget? :)
replies.body_tagged: What's your budget? :)

replies.body: Anywhere below £450, preferably with an OS included
replies.body_tagged: Anywhere below £450, preferably with an OS included

replies.body: Laptop or desktop?
replies.body_tagged: Laptop or desktop?

reply_to.body: Anywhere below £450, preferably with an OS included
reply_to.body_tagged: Anywhere below £450, preferably with an OS included

replies.body: Either
replies.body_tagged: Either

replies.body: For a desktop, do you want it premade or would you want to build it? Building it would be much more cost effecient.
replies.body_tagged: For a desktop, do you want it premade or would you want to build it? Building it would be much more cost effecient.

replies.body: I'm not too confident with building it myself, but if I could look into it, I'd give it a go
replies.body_tagged: I'm not too confident with building it myself, but if I could look into it, I'd give it a go

reply_to.body: For a desktop, do you want it premade or would you want to build it? Building it would be much more cost effecient.
reply_to.body_tagged: For a desktop, do you want it premade or would you want to build it? Building it would be much more cost effecient.

replies.body: another option is to get a cheaper prebuilt one and then add better parts to it. that's what i'm doing. 450 pounds in us dollars is almost $700. you could definitely afford one prebuilt, but if you build one you'll save money. just make sure you know how to do it :)

replies.body: I bought a decent second hand desktop for about £180. added another 4 gigs of ram and a new average gpu making a total of £30 on upgrades. I run minecraft anywhere between 80-150 fps. So imo, get a cheap, cheap desktop. then spend some money on upgrading it. (Make sure all the parts are compatible though)
replies.body_tagged: I bought a decent second hand desktop for about £180. added another 4 gigs of ram and a new average gpu making a total of £30 on upgrades. I run minecraft anywhere between 80-150 fps. So imo, get a cheap, cheap desktop. then spend some money on upgrading it. (Make sure all the parts are compatible though)

replies.body: Build your own APU computer, you don't really need a graphics card for Minecraft and you can run Minecraft Max settings with 60fps. It's really simple to build, check some tutorials online.
replies.body_tagged: Build your own APU computer, you don't really need a graphics card for Minecraft and you can run Minecraft Max settings with 60fps. It's really simple to build, check some tutorials online.

replies.body: Ya i would recomend building one your self, because i too am saving up for a better computer mine is pretty bad
replies.body_tagged: Ya i would recomend building one your self, because i too am saving up for a better computer mine is pretty bad

replies.body:
My first impulse was to recommend an iMac.

Then I saw your budget.

I guess PC is the way to go for you, and, as others suggest, spend some time and money upgrading it.
replies.body_tagged:
My first impulse was to recommend an iMac.

Then I saw your budget.

I guess PC is the way to go for you, and, as others suggest, spend some time and money upgrading it.

replies.body:
That's a dead socket. Very bad idea if he EVER wants to upgrade to an i5/i7

This system will play basically every game with High or even Ultra settings :) 
http://uk.pcpartpicker.com/p/cVXrnQ

Also fits your budget of 450 pounds. If you need help with anything, my skype is greggorman12.

replies.body:
The AMD APU will last him a long time.... Tbh, Intel is just more expensive for barely better performance... + When the APU becomes old, It will be about time to get a new motherboard too...

I still think my Build is good, Intel, really don't like their prices. Unless you do some crazy 60fps1080p rendering, you dont need an i3,i5,i7 etc.

:P

+ your build, the case doesnt support, the GPU...  Might as well go with NVIDIA the 750 ti...
replies.body_tagged:
The AMD APU will last him a long time.... Tbh, Intel is just more expensive for barely better performance... + When the APU becomes old, It will be about time to get a new motherboard too...

I still think my Build is good, Intel, really don't like their prices. Unless you do some crazy 60fps1080p rendering, you dont need an i3,i5,i7 etc.

:P

+ your build, the case doesnt support, the GPU...  Might as well go with NVIDIA the 750 ti...

What are you going to use the computer for? (Be specific)

What country do you live in?

Do you prefer quality or quantity?

Whats your real max top budget you cannot go over?
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
You lack computer knowledge don't you? First off, that CPU isn't an APU. Second, my build is around the same price and performs way better.

i3 > 860K
280X > 750 ti (by a bunch)

Also, the case does support the video card. It's just that he can't put in a ton of hard drives. (He will still be able to fit 2-3, which is a whole lot)

Not to forget if he gets money later on, he can just buy an i5. With your option he has to buy a whole new motherboard
replies.body_tagged:

Also, the case does support the video card. It's just that he can't put in a ton of hard drives. (He will still be able to fit 2-3, which is a whole lot)

Not to forget if he gets money later on, he can just buy an i5. With your option he has to buy a whole new motherboard

replies.body:
Are you just going to play minecraft or your planning to play other games as well?

Well, i would suggest building a desktop because its cheaper. Building is not that hard but you just gotta be really carful when building. Other than that, its like buuilding a lego set tbh :/ (i buillt an old computer before)

replies.body:
Buy a pre-built one or you cant design you own here : https://www.pcspecialist.co.uk/ also you can pay monthly payments instead of on the spot paying like £700.00 or $1078.77 . 

Which I find amazing and you can get it with whatever graphics card or Processor you want and Design laptops or desktop computers and many more !
